label: Description
value: Delicate repeats widely spaced vertically of wisteria branch and some kind of kite or toy. In natural and soft shades of red, gold, and green on dark blue ground. Breadth with plain selvedges continuous with ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: hemp or ramie Technique: resist dyed, and free brush coloring (yuzenzome)

label: Description
value: Length of indigo-dyed fabric, with a closely spaced design of swooping phoenixes and bunches of leaves and flowers, interspersed with small symbols in white on a deep blue ground. Selvedge on each side set off by a narrow weft ikat stripe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: hemp or ramie Technique: warp and weft ikat (kasuri) on plain weave

label: Description
value: Coarsely-woven orange ground with widely spaced warp ribs has a design in reserve white of snow-covered pine branches. One narrow selvedge more tightly woven than ground.

label: Description
value: Design of scattered fruits in white showing crackle of paste reserve on a dark purple ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: stencil resist (katazome) on plain weave crepe

label: Description
value: Traditional all-over geometric design of octagons framing rosettes, and tilted squares, in dark blue and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, indigo dyed, resist applied by stencil (katazome)

label: Description
value: Weft-ribbed tabby ground with large roundels of pine, bamboo or plum scattered in ground of continuous curling arabesques, reserved in white on dark greenish-gray ground.

label: Description
value: Stylized over-all repeat of Pawlonia leaf and flowers in continuous scrolls.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, indigo dyed, resist applied by stencil (katazome)

label: Description
value: Length of resist-dyed cotton with broad sweeping water forms framing two turtles swimming toward each other, with flowering plum and pine branches. In white, gray and black on a blue ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, patterned with stencil-applied paste resist (katazome) indigo dyed

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Oval and circular floral rosettes in dotted goemetrical framework, forming overall pattern, In white with occasional hand application of orange, on blue ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, indigo dyed, resist applied with stencil (katazome)

label: Description
value: Figural groups from Burmese iconography, in close-set vertical repeat about 16" high. Blue ground, right half textured with tiny white dots and left half with faint yellow bars suggesting architectural framework. Reds browns, and tans. two wide cloth selvedges with double warps.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, vegetable dyes Technique: printed

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 79 x 77 cm (31 1/8 x 30 1/4 in.) Repeat H: 40.6 cm (16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Flat circular base, narrow knobbed stem and flaring "tulip" - type top of opal and amber glass, with green speckles and stripes on base and stem, forming veins of petal-like shape on top.

label: Provenance
value: 1956: acquired by Museum (from Maud E. Dillard)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Georgiana L. McClellan

label: Description
value: Silk brocade with a loose lattice framework formed of naturalistic flowers and leaves, in pale greens, pinks and oranges on an off-white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: woven with continuous and discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Marie Torrance Hadden

label: Description
value: Small rectangular painting on vellum, showing an orange tree in a tub set in a flowered landscape, is imposed on a silhouette cut-out showing curtains, doves, rampant lions and a crown.  The whole attached to a pink paper ground with escolloped edges.  Gilt paper and paint outline the various members of the cut-out.

label: Dimensions
value: Central panel: 11 x 9 cm (4 5/16 x 3 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Fragment of a quilted textile. Woven cotton textile resist-dyed in two shades of blue on white background showing pattern of leaves and fruit. Interlined with wool and backed with faded pieces of plain cotton, or cotton printed in very small geometric patterns. Quilting is done in diagonal lines.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool batting Technique: block-printed and resist-dyed plain weave, quilted

label: Description
value: Fragment of a quilted textile. Woven cotton textile resist-dyed in two shades of blue on white background showing pattern of leaves and fruit. Interlined with wool and backed with faded pieces of plain cotton, or cotton printed in very small geometric patterns. Quilting is done in diagonal lines.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool batting Technique: block-printed and resist-dyed plain weave, quilted

label: Description
value: Piece of patchwork consisting of alternating patches made from two different fabrics, about 4 inches square. One fabric has flowers in red, dark brown and violet with black outlines for stems on a white ground. The other fabric has two shades of violet-brown in vertical stripes with a tiny flower head design reserved in white. Cotton is coarse and heavy.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: patchwork of printed fabric

label: Description
value: Incomplete medallion and diamond formed of patches of various small-patterned 19th century printed cottons, glazed and unglazed. On reverse, cotton printed in dark purple with large basket of flowers and fruit on swirling picotage ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: pieced and quilted plain weave

label: Description
value: Vertical serpentines of flowers form an ogival framework for vignette of dancing couple along with two small animals playing the drum and zither. German verse appears below the dancing couple. Printed in reddish-brown on natural linen ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 120 x 71 cm (47 1/4 x 27 15/16 in.)

label: Notes
value: Vertical serpentines of flowers form an ogival framework for vignette of dancing couple along with two small animals playing the drum and zither. German verse appears below the dancing couple. Printed in reddish-brown on natural linen ground.

label: Description
value: Dress fragment of fine white cotton muslin. Broad border of colored wool and gold embroidery showing scattered wheat sheaves and bunches of grapes tied with ribbons.  Sequins encircle wheat and form clusters along border, above a band of frayed metallic yarn.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton foundation, wool and metallic embroidery, sequins Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1956: Mrs. Benjamin Ginsburg collection; 1956: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: a) Figure of a seated figure in blue-gray trousers and green coat, on circular plinth decorated with masks and shells. Threaded circular opening on belly. b) conical pierced hat. c) tube with square slide holder. d) upainted projector tube, lens missing. e) circular slightly domed cover.

label: Provenance
value: Frederick P. Victoria; 1956: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Square of unbleached muslin with bold floral border and central sprigs stenciled in red, blue, green opaque paints.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: stenciled on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. The figures of the actor Louis Bercher, called "Dauberval" (1728-1803) and the actress Marie Allard (1742-1802) are seen in a wooded landscape in the act of doing a ballet dance. The scene is Act II of the opera "Sylvie" by P. M. Bertoux Trial. Five lines of verse from the opera in lower margin.

label: Description
value: a) Is located in Applied Arts Dept. Rectangular box, slightly curved, with rounded corners and hinged cover. Guilloche pattern with rosettes in niello on cover and bottom, diaper pattern on sides. Inside gilt. Marks: St. George, maker's initials "F.L.", silver content 84, and date 1836. b,c) Rectangular box and cover. Glossy or satin white ground and flocking, block printed in shades of pink, blue and green distemper colors. Remains of a red wax seal on the cover.

label: Provenance
value: Belonged to grandfather of donor, Jacob Lang (1813-1846) of Danville, Pennsylvania.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Minnette Lang, in memory of her father, Otto J. Lang

label: Description
value: Truncated cone-shaped bowl of silver, the outside covered with vertical staves of ebony and ivory alternating, interrupted by band inscribed with: “The Gift of AS to her Grandson RS 1789.” Three handles set horizontally.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1957: Lord Lauderdale; 1957: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Asymmetrical flat bowl with one point, and five ogee lobes on one side and one on the other, the whole gilded. Stem, pierced in radiating design. Handle flat and angular, ending in thistle flower. Relief interlacing with trefoil reserve containing monogram JAD.

label: Description
value: A silver hoop with molded decoration on both edges holds the lens in a groove. It screws into a handle with repoussé shells, cherub heads, cartouches and flowers.

label: Description
value: Each candlestick has a square plinth and cylindrical truncated fluted column of white marble with ribbed molding on base and top in gilt bronze. Striding bronze putto with one arm lifted and holding gilt bronze cornucopia with partly reeded candle socket with screwed baboche.

label: Provenance
value: Henry Symonds, London; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Part a, square marble plinth supporting gilt bronze tripod with lions feet and heads; snake twisted around center stem; marble bowl mounted in wide band; double chains hanging from ring held by lions' heads. Part b, dome-shaped marble lid with gilt bronze pine cone finial; interior fitted with gilt bronze nozzle for candle (can be inverted to act as candle holder).

label: Description
value: Handle with silver overlay on mother-of -pearl, the silver as chased foliage, flowers and vines.  Marked "Gorham Mfg. Co. STERLING" on steel base.

label: Description
value: Ovoid bowl with frosted finish to interior. Tapering stem with small gadrooned knop below the pointed, rounded terminal which is stamped with scrolling vines and a dove on a matted ground. Obverse with monogrammed trefoil-topped heart-shaped reserve.

label: Description
value: Octagonal basket with flaring sides pierced in bands of lancets and circles. Four ball feet.

label: Description
value: Orb-shaped infuser with chain; stand with wire work support on circular dish with scroll border.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (tea infuser): 6.1 x 5 cm (2 3/8 x 1 15/16 in.) H x diam. (stand): 1.3 x 7.6 cm (1/2 in. x 3 in.)

label: Description
value: Flat pocket of hand-woven fabric, embroidered in a floral design in colored wools. Bound at edges and at opening for hand in fragments of dark, block-printed linen. Waist tapes are missing.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen warp, cotton weft, wool embroidery Technique: embroidered on plain weave Label: linen warp, cotton weft, embroidered with wool
Kettle and lid on stand with lamp and lid

label: Description
value: (a) Bulbous body with molded neck, paneled covered spout and pivoting-shaped handle with turned wood centerpiece. Side engraved with scrolled arms. (b) Molded cover with wood knob; (c) stand on three baluster legs on square plinth with large ring for kettle, smaller for lamp; (d) cylindrical lamp with (e), cover with inner spout and hinged top to cover it.

label: Object Type
value: Kettle and lid on stand with lamp and lid

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (a/e: overall): 36 x 26 x 21 cm (14 3/16 x 10 1/4 x 8 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: A plate with a wavy, brown-edged rim. Decoration showing flowering plant and insects.

label: Description
value: A plate with a wavy, brown-edged rim. Decoration showing flowering plant and insects.

label: Description
value: A plate with a wavy, brown-edged rim. Botanical decoration of a Magnolia. Thick purple and green stem with yellow, green, and purple lanceate leaves. Large flower with yellowish curling petals and cone-shaped purple and green pistil. Sprigs of yellow and blue flowers. Two large butterflies, one moth. The decoration after Georg Dionysius Ehret (1708-1770), PLANTAE SELECTAE, 1770-1773, Tab.IX,  "Magnolia..."

label: Provenance
value: Irwin Untermyer, Esq.; 1957: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: A plate with wavy, brown-edged rim painted with a large spray of sunflower (Helianthus atrorubens), showing a blossom, buds, and leaves, with various insects.

label: Description
value: Rectangular base resting on moulding and slight feet. On front, moulding in shaoe of rectangle with concave corners. Slender case with arched door. Clock house projecting, with cut, fluted corners, arched glass windows on side, and arched door. Above, cut-out scrollwork below concave arched top, and three brass urn-and-flame- finials. Brass face partly engraved, deocrated with applied scrolls. Four white enamel ring dials and name plate.
